name: Arambourgiania
overview: Arambourgiania is a aerial reptile currently documented from an uncertain time interval with uncertain geographic attribution. Current interpretation suggests a carnivore feeding profile. It is typically classified as Pterosauria. Evidence quality for Arambourgiania is currently limited by specimen completeness and historical naming complexity. Dino-pedia tracks this taxon with conservative wording so future specimen-level studies can be integrated without overwriting uncertain claims.

researchContext.evidenceBase: Arambourgiania is represented by published fossil material, but completeness and diagnostic overlap can limit high-confidence biological reconstruction.
researchContext.currentLimits: Several ecological and life-history traits remain inferential rather than directly measured for this taxon.
researchContext.nextDataNeeded: Priority evidence includes better-preserved cranial/postcranial overlap, robust stratigraphic control, and specimen-linked morphometrics.
